and other exotic materials) close (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels) one non-mythic creature/3 levels 2 hours/level; see text Will negates (harmless) yes (harmless) Normal Use

You imbue a number of creatures with mythic power
column11:
granting each of them 1st tier in a mythic path of its choice. The creatures immediately gain the benefits of their chosen paths. Divide the duration evenly among all targets.

The targets retain their mythic tier only while they're within 100 feet of the spell's focus component. A target that goes outside this range loses its mythic tier
column12: but instantly regains it if it moves into range again. If the focus component is destroyed while the spell is in effect
column13:
the spell immediately ends and all targets gain 1d4 permanent negative levels.

Mythic: If you expend one use of mythic power when casting this spell
column14: the duration increases to 1 day per level
column15: and you can use yourself as the focus for this spell instead of a lesser artifact. If you're the focus
column16: the targets retain their mythic tier only while they're within 100 feet of you
column18: the spell immediately ends and all targets gain 1d4 permanent negative levels.

column1: Bleed Glory	Bleed Glory	necromancy [curse]	cleric 3
column4:

The mythic power cost for all path abilities
column7: and other effects used by the target increases by 1.

column6:
S touch living creature touched 1 round/level Fortitude negates (harmless) yes (harmless) Normal Use

The target's soul is strongly anchored to its body
column7: preventing death from hit point damage. No matter how low the target's hit points get
column8:
it remains alive (though not necessarily conscious).

This spell doesn't prevent death from sources other than hit point damage--such as Constitution damage or drain
column10:
or energy drain. Spells that cure hit points affect the creature normally.

Mythic: If you expend one use of mythic power when you cast the spell
column11: you become an anchor for the souls of you and your cohorts. The range increases to 30 feet
column12: and instead of affecting one creature
column13:
it affects all allies within a 30-foot-radius emanation centered on you.

Augmented (8th): If you expend three uses of mythic power
column15: and the area to a 1-mile-radius emanation centered on you.

column1: Lend Path	Lend Path	transmutation	bard 4
column8:
S touch creature touched 10 minutes/level (D) Will negates (harmless) yes (harmless) Normal Use

You temporarily transfer one of your mythic path abilities to another creature
column9: which can use it as if it were part of the creature's own path. If the target is unable to expend mythic power
column10: it can't activate any part of the ability that requires expending uses of mythic power
column11:
but the ability otherwise functions as if the creature were 1st tier.

While your path ability is transferred in this way
column12: you can't use it yourself (even if it's an automatic ability or one that doesn't require expending uses of mythic power).

column1: Mythic Severance	Mythic Severance	necromancy [curse]	cleric 4
column5:
S close (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels) one creature permanent Will negates yes Normal Use

You restrict the target's access to its mythic power. Each time the target attempts to cast a mythic spell
column6: expend mythic power to activate a path ability
column7: or use any other effect that requires expending uses of mythic power
column8: it must attempt a Will saving throw against the DC of this spell. If it fails this saving throw
column9:
the creature loses its action and the ability it was attempting to use has no effect.

This spell has no effect on mythic abilities that don't require the target to expend mythic power.

column1: Restore Mythic Power	Restore Mythic Power	transmutation	bard 3

S touch you and one mythic creature instantaneous Will negates (harmless) yes (harmless) Normal Use

By laying your hands on the target
column6: you're able to transfer some of your mythic essence to the target. You expend three uses of your mythic power to restore one use of the target's mythic power.

column1: Share Glory	Share Glory	transmutation	bard 2

S close (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels) one non-mythic creature/3 levels 1 minute/level Will negates (harmless) yes (harmless) Normal Use

You imbue the targets with a fraction of your mythic nature. They count as mythic creatures for the purpose of path abilities
column9: and other effects that function differently for mythic creatures. This doesn't grant the targets mythic tiers or any uses of mythic power; it merely gives them a greater advantage when others use abilities that work differently for mythic creatures. You must be at least a 1st-tier mythic character to cast this spell.

column1: Steal Power	Steal Power	necromancy	cleric 5
column4:
S close (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels) one mythic creature instantaneous Will negates yes Normal Use

You sap the power from a mythic creature
column5: using it to restore your own. The target loses 1d4 uses of mythic power. If you have the ability to expend mythic power
column6: you regain one use for each use the target loses.

centered on you 1 day/level (see text) none no Normal Use

You alter the area's terrain and climate to a new terrain and climate type appropriate to the planet or plane. For example
column10: you might transform a desert to plains. To cast this spell
column11: you must expend 10 uses of mythic power along with the material cost. This magically alters the area's climate and normal plants to those appropriate to the new terrain
column12: but doesn't affect creatures or the configuration of the earth. Transforming rocky hills into forested areas converts grasses into shrubs and small trees
column13:
but doesn't flatten the hills or change the animals to suit the new environment.

You can alter the climate by one step (warm
column15: or cold). The maximum extent of the terrain change is up to the GM
column16: but in general is to a similar terrain type or one step within that terrain type (such as from a typical forest to a forest with massive trees or light undergrowth
column17: from a shallow bog to a deep bog
column18: and so on). You might be able to shift the land to a similar terrain type
column19: such as turning a sparse forest into a relatively dry swamp. Local creatures adversely affected by these alterations either flee the area or quickly die
column20:
depending on their mobility and awareness of the change.

Multiple castings of the spell in the same area can create an area with radically different terrain and climate than the surrounding land. The GM can decide that certain terrain shifts are unsustainable and shorten the duration
column21:
or that some are suitable for the area and extend the duration.

This spell could have many secondary effects based on the nature of the change
column23: and so on; these should be determined by the GM on a case-by-case basis. For example
column24: transforming a desert requires drawing water up from underground to sustain the plants
column25:
which could deplete the water table in nearby areas. Creating a warm desert in the middle of a snowy tundra will create a bordering area of mud and frequent storms from the clash of hot and cold air fronts.

If you're at least 8th tier
column26: you can expend 20 uses of mythic power instead of 10 to increase the range to 1 mile
column27: the area to a 1-mile-radius emanation centered on you
column28: and the duration to 1 month per caster level.
